title: J86-3001

sentences.text: In this paper we explore a new theory of discourse structure that stresses the role of purpose and processing in discourse .

In this theory , discourse structure is composed of three separate but interrelated components : the structure of the sequence of utterances -LRB- called the linguistic structure -RRB- , a structure of purposes -LRB- called the intentional structure -RRB- , and the state of focus of attention -LRB- called the attentional state -RRB- .
The linguistic structure consists of segments of the discourse into which the utterances naturally aggregate .
The intentional structure captures the discourse-relevant purposes , expressed in each of the linguistic segments as well as relationships among them .
The attentional state is an abstraction of the focus of attention of the participants as the discourse unfolds .
The attentional state , being dynamic , records the objects , properties , and relations that are salient at each point of the discourse .
The distinction among these components is essential to provide an adequate explanation of such discourse phenomena as cue phrases , referring expressions , and interruptions .
The theory of attention , intention , and aggregation of utterances is illustrated in the paper with a number of example discourses .
Various properties of discourse are described , and explanations for the behaviour of cue phrases , referring expressions , and interruptions are explored .
This theory provides a framework for describing the processing of utterances in a discourse .

Discourse processing requires recognizing how the utterances of the discourse aggregate into segments , recognizing the intentions expressed in the discourse and the relationships among intentions , and tracking the discourse through the operation of the mechanisms associated with attentional state .
This processing description specifies in these recognition tasks the role of information from the discourse and from the participants ' knowledge of the domain .

Entity-a_new_theory_of_discourse_structu.label: a new theory of discourse structure
aliases: a new theory of discourse structure
Entity-a_new_theory_of_discourse_structu.description: A theoretical framework that posits discourse structure as composed of three interrelated components: linguistic structure, intentional structure, and attentional state, emphasizing the roles of purpose and processing in shaping discourse.

mentions.local_name: a new theory of discourse structure

Entity-these_component.label: these components
Entity-these_component.description: The three interrelated structural components of discourse: linguistic structure (sequence of utterances), intentional structure (purposes and relationships among them), and attentional state (dynamic focus of attention).

Entity-intentional_structure.label: intentional structure
Entity-intentional_structure.description: A conceptual framework that captures the purposes expressed in each linguistic segment as well as relationships among them, essential for explaining discourse phenomena such as cue phrases, referring expressions, and interruptions.

Entity-the_role_of_information_from_the_.label: the role of information from the discourse
aliases: the role of information from the discourse
Entity-the_role_of_information_from_the_.description: The process of recognizing how utterances aggregate into segments, identifying intentions expressed in a discourse, and tracking the discourse's progression through attentional state mechanisms.

mentions.local_name: the role of information from the discourse

Entity-theory_of_attention__intention__a.label: theory of attention, intention, and aggregation of utterances
aliases: theory of attention, intention, and aggregation of utterances
attention, intention, and aggregation of utterances
Entity-theory_of_attention__intention__a.description: A conceptual framework explaining how individuals process and respond to linguistic stimuli by attending to certain aspects, forming intentions based on those stimuli, and aggregating their verbal outputs.

mentions.local_name: theory of attention, intention, and aggregation of utterances
attention, intention, and aggregation of utterances

Entity-discourse-relevant_purpose.label: discourse-relevant purposes
aliases: the discourse-relevant purposes, expressed in each of the linguistic segments as well as relationships among them
Entity-discourse-relevant_purpose.description: Intentional structures that capture the purposes and relationships between them within a discourse.

mentions.local_name: the discourse-relevant purposes, expressed in each of the linguistic segments as well as relationships among them

Entity-the_distinction.label: The distinction
Entity-the_distinction.description: A fundamental separation among three interrelated components of discourse structure: linguistic, intentional, and attentional states.

Entity-various_property_of_discourse.label: Various properties of discourse
Entity-various_property_of_discourse.description: The various characteristics or features that define a discourse, including its linguistic structure, intentional structure, attentional state, and relationships among these components.

Entity-cue_phrase__referring_expression_.label: cue phrases, referring expressions, and interruptions
aliases: cue phrases, referring expressions, and interruptions
such discourse phenomena as cue phrases, referring expressions, and interruptions
Entity-cue_phrase__referring_expression_.description: Discourse phenomena characterized by linguistic structures, intentional purposes, and attentional states.

mentions.local_name: cue phrases, referring expressions, and interruptions
such discourse phenomena as cue phrases, referring expressions, and interruptions

Entity-the_role_of_purpose_and_processin.label: the role of purpose and processing in discourse
aliases: the role of purpose and processing in discourse
Entity-the_role_of_purpose_and_processin.description: The concept referring to the significance and function of purpose and processing in shaping the organization, development, and comprehension of a discourse.

mentions.local_name: the role of purpose and processing in discourse

Entity-the_operation_of_the_mechanism_as.label: the operation of the mechanisms associated with attentional state
aliases: the operation of the mechanisms associated with attentional state
Entity-the_operation_of_the_mechanism_as.description: The process by which a speaker's or listener's focus of attention evolves over time in response to the unfolding discourse, involving the dynamic recording and updating of salient objects, properties, and relations.

mentions.local_name: the operation of the mechanisms associated with attentional state

Entity-a_structure_of_purpose.label: a structure of purposes
Entity-a_structure_of_purpose.description: A conceptual framework that captures the purposes or intentions expressed in a discourse, including relationships among them.

Entity-a_number_of_example_discourse.label: a number of example discourses
Entity-a_number_of_example_discourse.description: A collection of illustrations used to demonstrate and explain the theory of attention, intention, and aggregation of utterances in discourse processing.

Entity-this_paper.label: this paper
Entity-this_paper.description: This research paper, titled J86-3001, explores a new theory of discourse structure emphasizing the roles of purpose and processing.

Entity-discourse_structure.label: discourse structure
Entity-discourse_structure.description: A theoretical framework or concept that describes the organization, arrangement, or pattern of language use in communication.

Entity-the_linguistic_structure.label: The linguistic structure
Entity-the_linguistic_structure.description: A conceptual framework that organizes a sequence of utterances into natural segments, capturing how they aggregate and relate to each other.

Entity-intention_expressed_in_the_discou.label: intentions expressed in the discourse
Entity-intention_expressed_in_the_discou.description: A mental construct representing a speaker's purpose or goal in communicating

aliases: segments of the discourse into which the utterances naturally aggregate
Entity-segment_of_the_discourse_into_whi.description: Units of spoken language that group related statements together

aliases: intentions expressed in the discourse and the relationships among intentions
Entity-intention_expressed_in_the_discou.description: The concept refers to the purposes or goals that are explicitly stated in a discourse, as well as the relationships between these intentions.

mentions.local_name: intentions expressed in the discourse and the relationships among intentions

Entity-discourse.label: discourse
Entity-discourse.description: A unit of language characterized by a coherent and meaningful sequence of words, phrases, or sentences.

Entity-linguistic_structure.label: linguistic structure
Entity-linguistic_structure.description: A theoretical framework or organization that underlies language use

Entity-purpose_and_processing_in_discour.label: purpose and processing in discourse
Entity-purpose_and_processing_in_discour.description: The concept or process by which language conveys meaning, including the intentions behind communication.

Entity-into_which_the_utterance_naturall.label: into which the utterances naturally aggregate
aliases: into which the utterances naturally aggregate
Entity-into_which_the_utterance_naturall.description: Segments of a discourse that contain groups of utterances

aliases: of the participants as the discourse unfolds
Entity-of_the_participant_a_the_discours.description: The dynamic state of focus of attention for all participants involved in a conversation, which records salient objects, properties, and relations throughout the unfolding discourse.

mentions.local_name: of the participants as the discourse unfolds

Entity-utterance_of_the_discourse.label: utterances of the discourse
Entity-utterance_of_the_discourse.description: A collection of spoken or written language units that convey meaning

Entity-state_of_focus_of_attention.label: state of focus of attention
Entity-state_of_focus_of_attention.description: An abstraction of the focus of attention of participants as a discourse unfolds, recording salient objects, properties, and relations at each point.

Entity-the_focus_of_attention_of_the_par.label: the focus of attention of the participants as the discourse unfolds
aliases: the focus of attention of the participants as the discourse unfolds
Entity-the_focus_of_attention_of_the_par.description: The central topic or theme being considered by individuals involved in a conversation, discussion, or narrative.

mentions.local_name: the focus of attention of the participants as the discourse unfolds

aliases: the processing of utterances in a discourse
Entity-discourse_processing.description: The process by which humans comprehend and interpret written or spoken language to extract meaning.

mentions.local_name: the processing of utterances in a discourse

Entity-relationship_among_them.label: relationships among them
Entity-relationship_among_them.description: Intentional structures and their relationships within a discourse

Entity-the_sequence_of_utterance.label: the sequence of utterances
Entity-the_sequence_of_utterance.description: A series of spoken or written statements that are naturally aggregated into segments.

Entity-record_the_object__property__and_.label: records the objects, properties, and relations that are salient at each point of the discourse
aliases: records the objects, properties, and relations that are salient at each point of the discourse
Entity-record_the_object__property__and_.description: A dynamic representation of the focus of attention in a discourse, tracking objects, properties, and relations that are salient at each point.

mentions.local_name: records the objects, properties, and relations that are salient at each point of the discourse

Entity-attentional_state.label: attentional state
Entity-attentional_state.description: A mental state characterizing an individual's focus on specific information or stimuli.

Entity-aggregation_of_utterance.label: aggregation of utterances
Entity-aggregation_of_utterance.description: A collection or accumulation of spoken language, such as conversations, dialogues, or monologues.

Entity-interruption.label: interruptions
Entity-interruption.description: A sudden or deliberate break in an ongoing conversation or speech, characterized by a shift from one speaker to another.

Entity-sequence_of_utterance.label: sequence of utterances
Entity-sequence_of_utterance.description: A series of spoken or written language units

Entity-processing_of_utterance.label: processing of utterances
Entity-processing_of_utterance.description: The act or mechanism by which linguistic input is analyzed, interpreted, and understood.

Entity-being_dynamic.label: being dynamic
Entity-being_dynamic.description: A mental representation of the focus of attention that changes over time to reflect the objects, properties, and relationships relevant to a given point in a discourse.

Entity-cue_phrase.label: cue phrases
Entity-cue_phrase.description: A linguistic device used to initiate or prompt a response from another speaker.

Entity-linguistic_segment.label: linguistic segments
Entity-linguistic_segment.description: A unit or phrase of language that forms a meaningful part of a larger text.

Entity-mechanism_associated_with_attenti.label: mechanisms associated with attentional state
Entity-mechanism_associated_with_attenti.description: Mechanisms that facilitate the processing and management of attention in cognitive processes or computational models.

Entity-purpose.label: purpose
Entity-purpose.description: A concept or intentional state that guides behavior towards achieving a specific goal

Entity-relationship_among_intention.label: relationships among intentions
Entity-relationship_among_intention.description: The connections or links between different goals, objectives, or purposes that exist within a particular context.

Entity-referring_expression.label: referring expressions
Entity-referring_expression.description: A linguistic device used to identify or point out an object, concept, or person in order to establish reference and facilitate communication.

Entity-focus_of_attention.label: focus of attention
Entity-focus_of_attention.description: The central aspect or subject that receives mental processing and consideration.

Entity-attention.label: attention
Entity-attention.description: A mental process that focuses on specific aspects or stimuli while ignoring others.

Entity-intention.label: intention
Entity-intention.description: A mental state or psychological concept that represents an individual's goal-directed behavior

Entity-theory.label: theory
Entity-theory.description: A conceptual framework or idea that provides an explanation for a particular phenomenon, process, or set of phenomena.

Entity-segment.label: segments
Entity-segment.description: A unit or division within a larger structure or system

Entity-component.label: components
Entity-component.description: A set of fundamental or constituent parts that together form a larger whole.

Entity-processing_description.label: processing description
Entity-processing_description.description: A written account or outline that outlines a process for analyzing, interpreting, or manipulating data

Entity-participant.label: participants
Entity-participant.description: Groups or individuals involved in a particular activity, process, or interaction.

Entity-paper.label: paper
Entity-paper.description: A written document presenting research findings or ideas on a specific topic, typically published and intended to share knowledge with others.

Entity-participant__knowledge_of_the_dom.label: participants' knowledge of the domain
aliases: from the participants' knowledge of the domain
Entity-participant__knowledge_of_the_dom.description: The collective understanding or expertise that individuals bring to a particular subject area

Entity-relation.label: relations
Entity-relation.description: A connection or linkage between entities

Entity-object.label: objects
Entity-object.description: Physical or abstract entities with distinct characteristics

Entity-recognition_task.label: recognition tasks
Entity-recognition_task.description: A set of procedures aimed at identifying or verifying entities, concepts, or patterns.

summary: In this paper we explore a new theory of discourse structure that stresses the role of purpose and processing in discourse . In this theory , discourse structure is composed of three separate but interrelated components : the structure of the sequence of utterances -LRB- called the linguistic structure -RRB- , a structure of purposes -LRB- called the intentional structure -RRB- , and the state of focus of attention -LRB- called the attentional state -RRB- . The linguistic structure consists of segments of the discourse into which the utterances naturally aggregate . The intentional structure captures the discourse-relevant purposes , expressed in each of the linguistic segments as well as relationships among them . The attentional state is an abstraction of the focus of attention of the participants as the discourse unfolds . The attentional state , being dynamic , records the objects , properties , and relations that are salient at each point of the discourse . The distinction among these components is essential to provide an adequate explanation of such discourse phenomena as cue phrases , referring expressions , and interruptions . The theory of attention , intention , and aggregation of utterances is illustrated in the paper with a number of example discourses . Various properties of discourse are described , and explanations for the behaviour of cue phrases , referring expressions , and interruptions are explored . This theory provides a framework for describing the processing of utterances in a discourse . Discourse processing requires recognizing how the utterances of the discourse aggregate into segments , recognizing the intentions expressed in the discourse and the relationships among intentions , and tracking the discourse through the operation of the mechanisms associated with attentional state . This processing description specifies in these recognition tasks the role of information from the discourse and from the participants ' knowledge of the domain .

Predicate-explore.label: explore
Predicate-explore.description: To explore means to investigate or examine something (typically an idea, concept, or phenomenon) with the intention of gaining a deeper understanding, uncovering new insights, or revealing hidden patterns. The subject is actively seeking knowledge by engaging with the object, which can be a theory, hypothesis, data set, or any other entity that requires exploration.

Predicate-stresses.label: stresses
Predicate-stresses.description: The predicate 'stresses' indicates a relationship where the subject emphasizes or highlights certain aspects or features of the object. This emphasis can be on specific characteristics, properties, or implications associated with the object.

Predicate-called.label: called
Predicate-called.description: The predicate 'called' indicates a naming or labeling relationship between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject has been given a specific name, label, or designation by which it can be referred to or recognized as being of a particular type or kind.

Predicate-consists_of.label: consists of
Predicate-consists_of.description: The predicate 'consists of' indicates a part-whole relationship between its subject and object. It suggests that the subject is composed or made up of one or more distinct parts, which are collectively referred to by the object.

Predicate-captures.label: captures
Predicate-captures.description: The predicate 'captures' indicates a relationship where the subject constrains or encompasses the object, often implying control, dominance, or containment. This connection suggests that the subject has some kind of influence over the object's meaning, significance, or scope.

Predicate-expresses.label: expresses
Predicate-expresses.description: To express means to convey or represent a particular concept, idea, or intention through a subject's actions, words, or other forms of communication. The predicate 'expresses' indicates that the subject (e.g., segments of discourse) conveys its meaning or purpose in relation to the object (e.g., discourse-relevant purposes).

Predicate-have_relationships_among_them.label: have relationships among them
Predicate-have_relationships_among_them.description: This predicate indicates that there exists a connection or association between the subject and object. The nature of these connections can vary depending on the context, but they imply some level of interdependence, similarity, or shared characteristics between the entities.

Predicate-is_an_abstraction_of.label: is an abstraction of
Predicate-is_an_abstraction_of.description: The predicate 'is an abstraction of' indicates a relationship where the subject represents a higher-level or more general concept that captures essential features from the object, which is typically a specific instance or manifestation of the same concept. This connection suggests that the subject provides a summary, simplification, or distillation of the key aspects present in the object.

Predicate-is_essential_to_provide_an_ade.label: is essential to provide an adequate explanation of
Predicate-is_essential_to_provide_an_ade.description: This predicate indicates that the subject plays a crucial role in providing a comprehensive understanding or insight into the object. The subject's presence, characteristics, or features are necessary for grasping the significance, meaning, or implications of the object.

Predicate-is_illustrated_in.label: is illustrated in
Predicate-is_illustrated_in.description: The predicate 'is illustrated in' indicates a relationship where the subject (a concept or idea) has its underlying principles, concepts, or ideas visually represented or explained through the object (typically an artistic work), providing a concrete representation of the abstract subject.

Predicate-illustrated_with.label: illustrated with
Predicate-illustrated_with.description: The predicate 'illustrated with' indicates that the subject (theory of attention, intention, and aggregation of utterances) is explained or exemplified by the object (a number of example discourses). It suggests a connection between the abstract concept described by the subject and concrete instances provided in the object. The predicate highlights how the theoretical concepts are demonstrated through specific examples.

Predicate-describe.label: describe
Predicate-describe.description: To describe a predicate means to convey or express information about its characteristics, features, or attributes. It involves providing an account or explanation that captures the essence of something, often using language to create a mental representation or image.

Predicate-describes.label: describes
Predicate-describes.description: The predicate 'describes' indicates a relationship where the subject provides an explanation or characterization of the object. It suggests that the subject offers a comprehensive and accurate representation, analysis, or interpretation of the object's nature, properties, or characteristics.

Predicate-have_relationships_among.label: have relationships among
Predicate-have_relationships_among.description: The predicate 'have relationships among' indicates a connection between two entities (subject and object), where the subject has some kind of relationship or structure with respect to the object. This relationship can be conceptual, logical, hierarchical, or any other type of structural organization that exists among the elements in question.

Predicate-specifies.label: specifies
Predicate-specifies.description: The predicate 'specifies' indicates a relationship where the subject provides or defines the meaning, scope, or characteristics of the object. It implies that the subject serves as a reference point for understanding the object's nature, function, or significance.

Predicate-plays_a_part_in.label: plays a part in
Predicate-plays_a_part_in.description: The predicate 'plays a part in' indicates that there exists an inherent connection or relationship between the subject and object. The subject contributes to or influences the object, which may be seen as a component, aspect, or characteristic of it.

Predicate-is_composed_of.label: is composed of
Predicate-is_composed_of.description: The predicate 'is composed of' indicates a part-whole relationship between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject is made up or constructed from one or more parts, which are represented by the object. This connection implies a hierarchical structure where the subject is the whole and the object represents its constituent components.

Predicate-comprises.label: comprises
Predicate-comprises.description: The predicate 'comprises' indicates that the subject encompasses or includes the object as a part or aspect. It suggests a relationship of containment, where the subject has the object within its scope, definition, or structure.

Predicate-emphasizes.label: emphasizes
Predicate-emphasizes.description: The predicate 'emphasizes' indicates a relationship where the subject (typically an entity or concept) highlights, accentuates, or draws attention to specific aspects of the object. This connection suggests that the subject's primary focus is on those particular features or characteristics of the object.

Predicate-requires_recognizing.label: requires recognizing
Predicate-requires_recognizing.description: The predicate 'requires recognizing' indicates that the subject needs to comprehend or understand the object in order for a particular process or relationship to hold true. In general, it suggests that there must be some level of cognitive awareness or interpretation of the object by the subject before certain implications can be drawn.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject concept is subsumed or encompassed by the object concept. It suggests a hierarchical relationship between the two concepts, where the subject is a more specific instance of the object.
